alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Monroe (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 10:30AM CDT until June 17 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Clarendon affecting Arkansas and Monroe Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, JUNE 17... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Clarendon. * WHEN...Until Friday, June 17. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, River flows in many side channels and creates islands between the river and sloughs and creeks. Flooding of cropland and timber is occurring. Portions of the National Wildlife Refuge downstream of Clarendon flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 26.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.5 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, June 16. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date White River Clarendon 26.0 26.4 Wed 10 AM 26.2 26.3 26.5 26.5 1 PM 6/11 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
